issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:

fields.summary: s3cmd cp fails with 1.5G+ files on riakcs

comments.body:
I am not seeing this failure at all on walrus. I do see it on even smaller files with
"objectstorage.dogetputoncopyfail = false" with riak. With this set to false I can only cp files up to about 150Mb
If I set objectstorage.dogetputoncopyfail =  true I can then cp a 1G file but not a 1.5G file.
There is a workaround. Customer is not likely to upgrade soon.

[~dmitrii], [~ataylor] Actually this may be a bug or configuration issue in Riak not eucalyptus.  The customer has objectstorage.dogetputoncopyfail = true which in 4.2 throws a 500 error because EUCA-12419 was not fixed until 4.3.
Having said that the customer in question is using Riak CS 2.1.3 which does support cp,mv and sync so the customer does not need to use this property which is inefficient anyway. I am currently looking into the riak code and configuration
to see how we can resolve this. With objectstorage.dogetputoncopyfail = false the cp,mv,sync will fail on files larger than 100MB and I need to find out why.
